intro: Syngonanthus trichophyllus, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense heads, surrounded by pale green bracts. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Syngonanthus trichophyllus thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
